title: Instagram brought back the chronological feed — here’s how to get it
content:
Ah, 2015. Phones still had headphone jacks, Donald Trump had never been president, and Instagram still had a chronological feed. Those were the glory days. And then, in early 2016, Instagram announced it was getting rid of the chronological feed in favor of algorithmic sorting, something no one asked for. The idea was to ostensibly sort content based on what’s most interesting to you. But pretty much no one was happy about it, and it yielded real ethical and political concerns beyond general annoyance. After six years of darkness, Instagram has finally seen the light. In December, it announced it…

description: Instagram brought back the chronological feed, but it's completely optional and can't be made permanent. Here's how to use it.
